alert.note: Alert for Jackson (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Meigs and central Jackson Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Racine, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ripley, Ravenswood, Sandyville, Kenna, Cottageville, Mount Alto, Statts Mills, Evans, Given, Leroy and Fairplain. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 127 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
